result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Adrian D. Knox

records.addlTxt: AMENDED Notice - Plea/sentencing hearing on June 2, 2022 at 02:00 pm. - Parties may appear via Zoom
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 2, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Case Called: 2:16p.m.
Clerk:  Micki.
INCLUDES 22CF42 and 22CF88

State appears by ADA Hannah Boeck.
Defendant appears in person, in custody from the MCJ; with Attorney Francisco Araiza.

Date and time set for a FPT (22CF88)/Review Hearing (22CF42). VRCW.

ADA Boeck advises parties have been in communication and have an agreement.
Atty Araiza provides court with plea questionnaire. He would also like for the defendant to appear via Zoom so he does not have quarantine for 10 days.
COURT GRANTS appearance by Zoom. 
COURT strikes JT. 

DATES:
Plea/Sentencing Hearing: 6/2/22 at 2:00p.m.

ADJ:  2:20p.m.
Final pre-trial on May 23, 2022 at 08:45 am.

Clerk:  Micki.
Called:  9:33a.m.
Includes cases 22CF42 and 22CF88

Date and time scheduled for Review/FPT.

State appears by Atty Hannah Boeck; Defendant does not appear, his Atty Francisco Araiza appears in person.
VRCW.

Defendant was recently transported to Dodge Corr. Inst. (April 27th) and arrangements were not made for today's court appearance.

ADA Boeck recites history of case; address motions. 
Atty Araiza makes statement on State's Motion in Limine.

COURT grants State's Motion in Limine on case 22CF88. 

FPT - 05/23/2022 at 8:45a.m. - Atty Araiza can appear via Zoom/arrangement for defendant to appear via Zoom.

JT to remain on calendar. 

ADJ: 9:41a.m.

Includes 22-CF-88 and 22-CF-42
22CF88 (speedy demand filed):
FPT/Motion in Limine set 5/05/22 at 9:30 am; Motions due by April 22, 2022
Jury Trial:  June 1, 2022 at 9:00 am (2 Days) 
22CF42 Tracking aloing
Calendar call on March 31, 2022 at 08:05 am.

Clerk: Nikki.
Case Called: 9:13am.
INCLUDES 22CF42 and 22CF88.
State appears by ADA Hannah Boeck; Defendant appears in person, in custody, and with Atty Francisco Araiza.
VRCW.

State has sent a global offer.
Atty Araiza notes no preliminary hearing has been held, deft would like to waive preliminary hearing in both cases.

Waiver of Prelim filed.
Court questions Defendant as to waiver.
Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.

COURT finds probable cause. Defendant bound over for arraignment and trial.
Information to be e-filed. R/W; R/J.

PLEA>> NOT GUILTY.

Atty Araiza requests speedy trial in 22CF88.
COURT asks Defense to confirm speedy trial demand in writing.

DATES:
CC: 3/31/22 @8:05am (Atty Araiza may telephone in, deft is excused).

Bond continues.

Adjourned: 9:20am.

Includes 22CF42, 22CF88
ADA Hannah Boeck appears in person; Defendant is in custody; Counsel has not been appointed yet
Remove the 2/17/22 Prelim 
Next date>> JPTC/Review of Counsel: 3/24/22 at 9:10 am
Review hearing on February 4, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
